Title: Golden Lotus Cooking School
Description:
We had a wonderful time with Linh at her cooking school. First, we selected the dishes that we would like to cook from more than 50 of choices on her menu and then she took us to the market where she showed as all spuces used by Vietnamese cuisine and we got all the ingredients necessary for the dishes we had chosen to make.
Then back at her beautiful chef's kitchen above the restaurant we learned hands on how to make each dish, from the chopping to the seasoning, cooking and presentation. She was very patient to teach my son at 10 years old and hel0 her to overcame the fears of cooking.
Finally, we got to enjoy the fruits of our efforts and a lovely gift of a cook book so we can try out more recipes at home. A highly recommended activity

Title: Saigon Back Alley Tours
Description:
Fab tour... Good chat on the tour guides spoke great English. My driver and tour guide was Vi and felt 100% confident with her behind the wheel (which is just as well given Vietnam rules of driving!). The tour guides work together so you ar really in a group of about 3 guides and 3 eaters. This worked really well
with parking, guiding, ordering and eating. The Hu Tien is my new favourite dish... I wish I'd done the tour at start of trip. ( but due to national holidays it was best the end). I was debating whether to do this tour or the more pricey xo tour... This one exceeded expectations... I. Sure xotours would have had more seafood / expensive dishes but I was after the street food experience which was delivered and then some... The break for sightseeing in the middle was fab too (stretch legs) Need a day to recover from food coma!!
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 1 trÃªn 870 Chuyáº¿n tham quan & hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ng á»Ÿ ThÃ nh phá»‘ Há»“ ChÃ­ Minh

Title: The Original Taste of Hoi An
Description:
Tasty, delicious, friendly, authentic and informative. We can't rate this tour highly enough. Loved every minute...the walk through the market, the local food outlets, finishing the tour in the customised kitchen ...... all gave us a good feel of the culture. Each of the guides were extremely personable and knowledgeable. We also appreciated the information they were happy to share about local events and services.
This was our second time doing the tour. The first was 6 years ago and we would encourage everyone to do this tour. With around 45 different dishes to taste there are too many photos to upload but here are a few to wet your appetite.

Title: Hanoi Cooking Centre
Description: This food tour was fantastic! My wife and I only had 2 nights in Hanoi, and we wanted to eat and learn as much as possible. Our guide Son is a very knowledgeable local chef. We started with pho and learned about the original recipe and secret ingredients, and also about how family recipes get passed down and used in Hanoi. We also ate bun cha, crab spring rolls, banh mi, and more. Son also took us to the originator of egg coffee, and it was the best we tasted in all of Vietnam. Highly recommended!

Title: Minh Hiá»ƒn Vegetarian Cooking Class Tour
Address: 30A Äinh TiÃªn HoÃ ng St., Há»™i An 560000 Viá»‡t Nam
Description:
This was a great trip. We bicycled a few kilometers out of town through the rich fields to to an area with fields of herbs and vegetables. Our guide Nhin (I hope I have his name right) had us taste and smell different herbs, from lemon mint, our favorite, to Vietnamese mint, which is a bit spicy and possibly in a different botanical family. There were stands of lemongrass, spring onions, garlic, and all manner of greens and other vegetables. The fields are contiguous small holdings, organic for 200 years. I liked this part quite a bit.
Pedaling back to town, we had Vietnamese pancakes, incredibly delicious. This version was a thin rice flour roll wrapping toated tofu and veggies. All three of thought this was untoppable.
When we got back to Minh Hien I (you might see Minh Hien II and III on Google maps), Nhin became more enthusiastic. We chopped veggies, then boiled and simmered then for broth. We chopped mushrooms, added herbs and condiments, proceeding to make mushroom sauce. We made sweet and sour sauce. Moving on, we made eggplant clay pot, papaya salad, fried tofu and a special Hoi An noodle dish. The timing and sequence of it all went perfectly. The broth and sauces made at the beginning were all integral parts of the subsequent dishes.
The brown Hoi An style rice noodles are made from a secret recipe known to only 5 families. They have a strict code of Omerta around the recipe.
It was an incredible dinner. The meat eater at the table was totally happy. Our only regret was that we could not finish eating everything.

I found this little â€œspeakeasyâ€ place by doing some research about the Hanoi bar scene. I contacted them via email from their Facebook page to ask for the â€œcodeâ€. We didnâ€™t really end up needing that however (though they did respond promptly)

The bar is very cute and importantly, has great drinks. Perhaps not the depth and breadth of selections youâ€™d probably get at a similar American place, but way more than enough to drink away a few, or more, hours

The experience was made even better by the two men who made our drinks. Nam and Quoc were so nice and amazing bartenders. They are knowledgeable about their craft and incredibly friendly- great to talk to them.

We really enjoyed our time there and wish we could have made a trip back before we left.

Thank you

We were a group of 5 brits travelling over from Singapore, we had a private tour which was great.

Title: Ann Tours
Description: My brother referred me to Tony at Ann Tours for a six adult family trip to Vietnam (he had thoroughly enjoyed his trip with Ann Tours a few years ago) and I am so thankful for the referral along with the experiences the people at Ann Tours delivered. Tony put together a very detailed itinerary based on some basic questions on our interests and the itinerary turned out to be absolutely spot on. The quality of the hotels, the activities, tours, cruises were top notch and we felt like we were totally spoiled the entire 2 weeks. The tour guides across Ho Chi Minh City/Mekong Delta, Central Vietnam and Hanoi areas were exceptional - Kang, Tu and Nam along with the van drivers were simply perfect for our family experience to learn more about the culture, the people and local cuisines. They made things so easy for our family and took care of all of our needs/wants. It was so clear that Ann Tours as a company team genuinely cares about its customer experience and we really appreciate it.

Title: Innoviet Travel
Description: Innoviet are a great company, hugely helpful and reliable. We are a UK family of 4 - with teenagers whose interest in history is variable at best - but our guide Hai did a fantastic job in holding everyone's interest throughout the trip! Knowledge, enthusiastic and friendly, Hai brought everything to life in an easy to understand way. And special shout out too to Trung in the office, who was so kind and helpful!! Ben Duoc is fascinating. We virtually had the place to ourselves. Some of us went into the tunnels, one or two didn't fancy it, all very easy either way. We got a real sense of the 'The American War', all in all a great trip! Highly recommended.

Description: This was a great experience! Mai and her husband were so welcoming, kind, and friendly. They hosted us on their beautiful courtyard filled with bonsai trees. We loved going on the market tour with Mai, who taught us about so many fruits, vegetables, and foods we haven't seen before. We even got to see fresh tofu being made. Mai bought many delicious things for us to try and the ingredients for the dishes we would be making. Mai taught us how to cook two dishes outside on the courtyard and then we had a delicious spread for lunch. We enjoyed talking with Mai and her husband and truly enjoyed this experience. Would recommend!

Title: Hue Flavor - Street Food Tour
Description: Absolutely amazing!!! The very best thing weâ€™ve done in Vietnam, and one of the best tours Iâ€™ve ever done around the world. Thom is an amazing guide, so knowledgeable and so kind. We were lucky enough to get a private tour being the only ones who booked in. He took us to such great spots we never would have found on our own - the food was incredible! It was so great to get the history and culture behind the food as well. We loved the visit to Dong Ba market and trying all sorts of different fruits. As someone who struggles in the heat, I was especially grateful of the care he and the cyclo drivers went to to keep us in the shade and seat us near fans. Canâ€™t recommend this tour enough, it will be the highlight of our trip.

Title: Danang On Bike
Description: Our guide was Lam, and he took us to a number of local restaurants to try different foods, many of which we had never eaten before. I liked Banh Xeo the best - pancake, papaya, cucumber and grilled pork, which we wrapped in rice paper and dipped in a peanut sauce. My husband liked Banh Canh the best - a noodle soup in a fish broth, which we added lime, quail eggs and deep fried bread to. We also tried Banh Beo and Banh Uot, and a number of different drinks. It was also nice to see some of the city at night while walking around, including the dragon bridge and the night market, which felt very touristy after all the other places we had been. Thanks again Lam, for a nice evening!

Title: Jason Super Star Service (SSS) - Day Tours
Description:
Jason Super Star Service did an amazing job touring our family in Vietnam. From learning countless historical facts, figures, and many other insights to and from the Cu Chi Tunnels (in a less-touristy location), where we visited remnants of the war: viewing underground hospitals, military planning rooms, and then participated in marksmanship training.

On our second day we gained more insight into how the local population lives by visiting the Ben Tre area, taking a boat to the middle of nowhere - hearing only the sounds of nature, floating our way to a home inside a local village. There we met a wonderful family that served us a delightful lunch that extended our normal dietary palate. Then, inside the coconut kingdom, we visited a local market, tasted snake rum, had an afternoon snack and listened to musicians serenade us with a short play, singing songs that told a beautiful love story.

We enjoyed the two-day tour so much, learning about Vietnam's history and how they thrive today locally, both from an economic and cultural standpoint. He took hundreds of photos for us and shared them at the end of each day's tour.

We highly recommend Jason Superstar Service for your next trip to Ho Chi Minh City!

Title: Halong Bay Tours
Description:
Booked a Halong Bay cruise (Swan Cruise), loved everything but... via Halong Bay Tours.
Positive: Our private transfer to Hai phong airport was smooth, we requested to leave two hours after the cruise ended, so we would not have to wait 4 hours in the airport. There wasn't much to see in walking distance from the port and we had just eaten another good dinner, so did not use the restaurants, but had a walk and a drink in the port (very quiet after the cruises had left).
Negative: The communication with the booking agency was not amazing. Every time it was a different person who replied, they did not reply to my questions and did not give me the information I asked for. I plan our trips myself, therefore I am a very demanding customer (I want details!), and the information regarding transfer on the HP, did not match the information I was received after booking. We had to leave 8.00 in the morning for the cruise, which embarked 13.30, a trip which takes about 2-2Â½ hours. They did not tell me why, but it is because they schedule a shopping stop after reaching Halong. It did not figure on the itinerary given (I think we wouldn't be the only ones to questions this stop), it was sold by the guide as a restroom/refreshments stop, we never got ANY kind of refreshments, but was ushered into a very depressing building with very boring assembly rooms with bad chairs. We guess, to receive as spiel about the products they sold in the shop, locally produced. We didn't want to hear a spiel in that dreary room, found nothing of interest in the shop and waited standing outside for the rest of the group. It was sold as a 30 min. stop, but took 95 min. And then it took 5 min. to reach the port. If we could have waited in the port, it would at least have been more pleasant.
Oh yeah, and the schedule said pickup from our hotel 8.15-8.45, which was changed to 8.00 the evening before (I did not see the change until morning). And the guide was waiting for us at 7.45. So we really loved that we had to rush check-out, without time for coffee, just to sit 95 min. waiting outside a shop (again NO COFFEE!).

Title: Vietnamese Cuisine With Locals
Description:
If you want to spend a pleasant morning with a lovely Vietnamese family as well as learning about some local culture, in addition to cooking your own delicious vegan food - then this is definitely for you.

I was greeted by Vi upon arrival. The tour started with a visit to the rooftop garden which provided many of the herbs to be used later on during the cooking experience.

In the apartment, Vi was helped by her young daughter, Minh, two of her school friends, Misa and Maika, and their mother, Moon, who welcomed me and two other guests to their apartment.

The first dish to be prepared was fresh spring rolls (goi cuon). A mix of Herbs and sliced shrimp were rolled in rice paper - something more difficult to do than it sounds, but there were plenty of local skilled hands to assist. We prepared a peanut butter sauce which served to accompany this dish.

It is difficult to know how to describe this first dish - delicious is probably an appropriate word.

I had previously tasted Vietnamese pancake and was pleasantly surprised to discovered that we would cook our own vegan version (banh xeo chay). After carefully preparing the pancake mix, we moved to the cooking area where Vi demonstrated the skills involved in getting the perfectly cooked pancake.

Vi explained that the name of the dish "Xeo" comes from the sound when the mixture is poured onto the hot oil, creating the sound "Xeo".

A fish oil and water based sauce with chilli and garlic was prepared by everybody prior to the best part - the tasting.

Next up, we prepared a delicious soup composed of soya milk, tofu, tomato, pineapple and mushroom called â€˜Bun rieu chayâ€™. I was given the task of squeezing the tofu before we made tofu shapes which were fried â€“ a very nice touch. We all sat down at the table and enjoyed the soup together and chatted about Vietnam and the local culture.

Feeling like stuffed tomatoes, we were informed that we had not yet tasted the dessert. Moon had just sliced and grilled some local small Vietnamese bananas (these tiny bananas are so sweet !!). These were accompanied by a coconut tapioca pudding. This delicious dessert was washed down with some butterfly pea tea (a purple tea with medicinal properties apparently prepared from the flowers of the butterfly pea plant !!).

We all left with some great memories, stories about Vietnam and the skills to replicate these dishes when at home.

The best advice I can give is come on an empty stomach â€“ the quantity and variety of the food will not disappoint.

An ideal experience for those who wish in visit a local family, learn some cooking and enjoy a very interesting morning when visiting Saigonâ€¦..
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 21 trÃªn 147 Lá»›p há»c & há»™i tháº£o á»Ÿ ThÃ nh phá»‘ Há»“ ChÃ­ Minh

Title: i Tour Viá»‡t Nam
Description: We booked this tour because we wanted to taste the flavors of Ho Chi Minh City and we got so much more. We were able to arrange a pick-up at our cruise terminal and our guide, Leah, took advantage of the time to tell us so much about the area and history of HCM. Once we reached the market area, Leah took us from place to place, explaining about the food and all the sights we were seeing. At our request, we combined the food tour with a general tour so we were able to see the top spots of the city before delving into the market. Even with the numerous closures due to the New Year celebrations, we were treated to Pho, Vietnamese pancakes, spring rolls, crab in a clay pot, a Vietnamese flan dessert, and coffee.Everything was delicious! Leah kept us learning the whole time and our conversation never wavered.She helped us shop in the market and get good prices on a few things to take home. The pictures she took and shared are amazing and the memories will last a lifetime. I can't express enough what a wonderful day this was and what a wonderful person Leah is. Thank you!

The luxury bus for transport had comfortable seats, leg room, and functioning AC. They always had water available for us. The activities (hiking, biking, temple) were enjoyable as well as educational. The trip to a local family's home was especially unique and memorable- the family was so kind, so welcoming and excited to see us, and we enjoyed seeing the local Vietnamese side of life. And the lunch was outstanding. There was so much food we couldn't finish it all, which is impressive for my husband and I. We thoroughly enjoyed our trip and will certainly recommend to others traveling here!

Title: Local Life Hoi An
Description:
What a wonderful experience Hi provided on our journey from Hue to Hoi An. Hi's polite and welcoming personanality enhanced the relaxing but scenic journey through Marble Pass, Da Nang and on to Hoi An. Throughout the trip, which included several stopovers, Hi provided us with descriptive dialogue enhancing our appreciation of Vietnamese history and culture. One memory which influenced our whole perception of Hi and probably of Vietnamese people in general was the concern and empathy he showed when we witnessed a tourist from another group take ill...we did not move on until Hi was satisfied the situation was under control. We felt extremely safe within Hi's care.

Thank you Hi, and you take a great photo!

Title: Hoi An Native and Social Travel
Description:
Enjoyed 6 hours with Luc. Pick up from resort , hubby rode his own scooter and Luc got the privilege of doubling me :) . Saw so many off the track sites weâ€™d never have seen on our own. Love the local culture, visiting homes & families that produce wood crafts , pottery, rice paper , sleeping mats .. learning from each other and soaking up not only the Sun but everything we experienced. Highly recommend this tour and Luc as your guide , we had such a great day.
Nadine & Craig
New Zealand

Title: Danang Hoian Private Tour
Description:
A tour like no other! This was our 3 rd time in Hoi An and we saw more and learned more on this tour than anything else we had done. Driving around in a local motobike and seeing the countryside of Hoi An is truly a once in a life time experience. We went to places you just couldnâ€™t find or would never know about unless you were with a true local. Our tour guide Tea was the BEST tour guide we have ever encountered in our many travels. Her knowledge, joy, humor, kindness and photo taking skills just made the whole experience so much more memorable. I donâ€™t want to spoil the itinerary too much but it is unique and varied and the included lunch is delicious. Our driver Kool was a legend too!
101% recommended for young and old and well worth the price!

Cáº£m Æ¡n Ã´ng bÃ , anh ChÃ¹, chá»‹ Chá», anh Dinh, chá»‹ An, RÃ¹a, Viá»‡t, báº¡n Ä‘á»“ng hÃ nh Nga BÃ¹i, má»i ngÆ°á»i vÃ  háº¹n gáº·p láº¡i áº¡.
â€”â€”
15 days at Indigenous Homestay is an impressive and amazing experience.
Everything here is provided at the most basic level: eat - sleep - clean hygiene, the seasoning is usually just salt and MSG, no TV, air conditioner or fan (there is still hot and cold water). Then I know that I really don't need too many things, my life still goes on and keeps comfortable. Everyday routine: cooking, listening to family stories, gathering around the fire and eating roasted sweet potatoes when the weather gets cold, every afternoon take Mickey for a walk in the terraced fields near homestay, learn basic H'mong sentences, â€¦ are all beautiful and unforgettable memories.
The tours of their family and Mr. Dinh are really interesting, lots of good information. Go to catch ticks with Rua, Viet and children in village, go to the stream to catch fish; harvest wild honey in the forest; go to beautiful view points around Mu Cang Chai are really worthwhile experience. Btw wild honey is very good.
Hope to be able to return in the other seasons such as the ripe rice season to harvest rice with the family, the apple season to see grandpa knitting a chair, the Lunar New Year season to see how everyone enjoy after a whole year of working.
Thank to grandparents, Mr. Chu, Ms. Cho, Mr. Dinh, Ms. An, Rua, Viet, my soulmate Nga and others do that I can have a wonderful trip.
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 1 trÃªn 1 Äá»“ Äƒn & Äá»“ uá»‘ng á»Ÿ Mu Cang Chai

Title: Experience Hoi An: Dong Family Cooking and Tours
Description:
Fantastic morning with Dong and his lovely wife, before cooking in their home with Dongâ€™s motherâ€™s guidance. First we cycled to markets for ingredients and refreshments, and then to a herb plot.
Great to have the chance understand the names and growth habits of the herbs that enliven Hoi An cuisine, and we â€˜workedâ€™ a plot briefly. It was more than a cooking (and delicious eating) session, but a wonderful insight into local life. Dongâ€™s English is good, and heâ€™s enthusiastic and generous about sharing food, culture and family.
Pleased to recommend this half day experience.

Title: Phat Loc Eco Cooking & Restaurant
Description: Mai was amazing! I booked a cooking class with her and ended up being the only person so I had my own private experience. She picked me up from Old Town on her scooter and we went to the market to pick up ingredients. I recommend booking the morning class as you will be able to experience the market at its peak with the freshest ingredients. I did the afternoon class so the market was a lot quieter but I didnâ€™t mind bc I like to sleep in lol. Then she scootered us over to her restaurant which was super cute. I took a ride in the crab boat with Maiâ€™s MIL. Even though we didnâ€™t speak the same language, we had a great time rowing, spinning, eating fruit off of a tree. She picked me a bouquet of flowers we found and even made me a crown and ring from leaves! Wicked cute!! Then we went back to the restaurant for a Vietnamese coffee and dried coconut snack. Mai set up a little foot bath for me which was a nice surprise. We then had our cooking class where we made way too much food for 1 person haha. It was such a lovely and unique experience. Iâ€™m so happy I booked with Mai!

Title: Hue Student Tour
Description:

Also, Chao, the tour organizer made a huge effort in taking my dietary restrictions (gluten free) into consideration. This is highly appreciated!

Title: Vespa Wanderers
Description:
Going on the Vespa tour was amazing. We got to experience Ho Chi Minh City by night in a way we would never had on our own or in a car. The buzzing street life with flower markets, restaurants, families eating outside was one of a kind.
Despite intense traffic, we felt very safe at the back of the vespa with the experienced drivers, who were very attentive to ensure we were alright and had a good time.
The Vespa Wanderers team did their utmost to make this a special event for us with excellent guiding and food. We truly recommend going on a vespa tour with this team of great people!

2. The local guide was helpful in getting good photo shots. Good recommendations on the local dishes to try out.

Title: Culture Pham Travel
Description: Ms. Xi was amazing. Best tour guide Iâ€™ve had in Vietnam. She did a walking tour of the Hue Imperial City, and tailored everything to what we were interested in. We didnâ€™t have much time in Central Vietnam so she made sure to include a lot of the history that we otherwise would have gotten at other sites. The tour was also advertised as 2.5 hrs but she was with us for 3.5, and willing to stay longer at no extra charge. She also answered all of our many historical questions beautifully and gave us some great local food recs! Highly recommend :)

Title: The Vietnam Tourism - Day Tours
Description: My wife and I used this company last year when we were interested in a golf vacation and Halong Bay cruise. It was under the name of Vietnam Golf Tours. We had a great experience with them at that time and had no hesitation in using them again. This time I wanted to take my business colleagues on a trip to Hoi An. This company arranged the hotels, domestic flights from Ho Chi Minh City and some tours for us while we were there. Using WhatsApp we had instant communication with them and they respond very quickly to any requests. It makes your trip a trouble free one. We love the ladies at this company and their strong customer focus.
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 93 trÃªn 456 Äá»“ Äƒn & Äá»“ uá»‘ng á»Ÿ HÃ  Ná»™i

Title: Asia Great Tours
Description:
Thank you to both Anna and Billy for a wonderful 10 days in Vietnam. Miss Anna worked hard with me to arrange our private tour trip exactly as I wanted. She was sweet, helpful, caring, and diligent, and a pleasure to work with. When she left the company we were smoothly transferred to Mr. Billy who did a wonderful job with last minute changes as a result of the start of the Corona virus. Our trip was everything I dreamed of and Mr. Billy made sure that every day was worry free, checking in with us in the evening with updates.
The price was reasonable, a bit more than I would have paid on my own, but worth it as I didn't have to worry about anything after arriving in Vietnam. We were picked up at the airport by a driver with our names and at every spot there was someone waiting to meet us. All the cars were very comfortable and drivers were courteous and friendly. I recommend using Vietnam Great Tours for your first time in Vietnam as they work hard to make your trip fun and worry free.

Title: Best Tour In Vung Tau

Chose some freshly caught sea food which was immediately put into a Cold box and taken back to Your Guide's Organic Farm. Spent following hours visiting many places of interest and learning about the Vietnamese/American War from the perspective of a Vietnamese. Visited family made dugouts and tunnels. Went to Organic Farm wandered around looking at various exitic crops before having the most delicious lunch which included our freshly caught sea food. Would highly recommend this trip as unique

If you're planning on visiting Hue and want the best and don't mind getting on a motorbike, then I couldn't recommend this service more highly!!
Please note that i was unable to submit the correct year on the web during the covid pandemic, I was very lucky to have been able to take part in such a great experience.

Title: Saigon Happy Tour
Description:
I had an amazing experience on the Cu Chi Tunnel tour with Saigon Happy Tour! Our guide, Happy, made the trip truly unforgettable. Happy's extensive knowledge about the tunnels and their history was both impressive and informative. He was not only passionate about sharing this history but also showed genuine care and attention towards our group throughout the tour.

Happy's enthusiasm and willingness to answer all our questions added depth to the experience. The Cu Chi Tunnels themselves were fascinating, and Happy's insights brought them to life. He ensured that everyone in the group felt comfortable and engaged, making the tour both educational and enjoyable.

I highly recommend Saigon Happy Tour, especially with Happy as your guide, for an exceptional Cu Chi Tunnel experience that you won't forget. Thank you for making our day so memorable!

I would recommend this tour as an introduction to Vietnamese cuisine and the street food world of Hanoi. I cannot praise Gin enough, she was the best!

Title: Hanoi Airport Cab
Description:
I had booked an airport transfer from HCM airport to my hotel. Unfortunately our inward flight was cancelled 4 hours after the scheduled departure from Australia to be rescheduled for the following day.

Within minutes of cancellation of the flight the SnartRide service contacted us by WhatsApp to reschedule to our new flight. This happened to coincide with a holiday weekend but a new transfer was organised without fuss.

The car was at the airport arrivals as rearranged fir a smooth ride to our hotel.

The service levels experienced were fantastic.

Title: Mr Binh Tours Hanoi
Description: An absolute amazing Ninh Binh day trip with Mr. Binh. I have done many tours living in South East Asia and Mr. Binh was the best so far. Door to door service, he is energetic, considerate, well spoken and very thoughtful in crafting the dayâ€™s activities with you. You can feel his passion when he explains the historical significance of the places you visit. He will adjust the itinerary any way you want it and dial up according to your intensity level. I have paid many multiples of money for this kind of service elsewhere and please donâ€™t ruin your short trip with a big group tour offered by the many hostels/shops on the street. Youâ€™ll be packed in large buses and shuttled around to commercialized, touristy spots if you do. Get really rural and local with Mr. Binh!

Title: Maia Food & Travel
Description: My wife and I spent a morning with Thanh on the Walking Street Food Tour in Hanoi and had a great time. The tour included six stops at local street food stalls to taste delicious, authentic North Vietnamese Street Food. There would have been more stops had I allowed for enough time. Thanh is super friendly and knowledgeable about both the food and cooking techniques. She also provided some recommendations for the next stop on our trip (Ho Chi Minh City). Anyone visiting Hanoi who is interested in sampling street food should go on this tour.

Title: MekongEcoTravel
Description:
We had an amazing time with this guide. We had a 2 days, 1 night tour with a lot of activities. She was attentive to our needs and although we are difficult to satisfy, we had no complaints, everything was perfect. We had a real taste of how life is in Mekong delta, and it was authentic and genuine. All the activities were very nice and interesting, we especially loved the boat trip in small canals, seeing heron birds and also the special secret activity in the evening, it was like a dream ! We learned how to cook the local dishes and could practice cooking it and taste it afterwards and many other really delicious dishes. We also learned about the work in the village, we roamed around in motorbike, visit an not touristic floating market, fish farm, fruit garden,noodle and cocoa factory and many more.
Our room at her house was also very cute and cosy. I strongly recommend booking this tour, we wouldn't want someone else to do it.
We want to thank her and her family again for hosting us and we hope to meet her again soon ğŸ¤—â¤ï¸

Title: Hidden Saigon
Description: Linh was our guide on the "Other than Pho" tour. Her sharing of her personal history of leaving Saigon as a child and returning as an adult made it even more interesting and meaningful. We ate at 3 great places, including one that was down an alley and felt like eating with the locals. Our Vietnamese coffee tour was excellent and even those in our party who are not big coffee fans loved the special drinks and education. We also appreciated having the time to shop and seeing a real working market. Having an air conditioned van rather than scooters meant we were cool and safe between stops, which was even better. We would definitely choose this tour or others by the same company. Thanks Linh!
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 90 trÃªn 326 Äá»“ Äƒn & Äá»“ uá»‘ng á»Ÿ ThÃ nh phá»‘ Há»“ ChÃ­ Minh

Title: Saigon Buddy Tours
Description: There are lots of tours in Ho Chi Minh City, but the Saigon Buddy city tour is a perfect introduction to the city. You sit on the back of a scooter, and the driver takes you on a four-hour tour of various neighborhoods. My friend booked us and she rode with Will, I rode with D. They're nice guys, very smart about the city and were great company. The tour hit highlights like Notre Dame Cathedral, a large marketplace, a gorgeous Buddhist temple, etc. But we also had pauses, like a stop to sample Vietnamese coffe, then a visit in the park to sit and sip lemon tea, and talk about the lifestyle and people of HCM City. And a key part of the fun is riding on the back of that motorbike. Traffic in this city seems to have no rules. But D and Will expertly maneuvered the crazy mix of cars, pedestrians and other scooters. There were a few hairy moments, but that's part of the fun. Don't let the idea of a scooter tour scare you; I'm retirement age and the biggest wuss around, and I loved every minute. So first recommendation: Take this tour. Second tip: Wear sunscreen. Other than that, put yourself in their hands and have a blast.
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 91 trÃªn 326 Äá»“ Äƒn & Äá»“ uá»‘ng á»Ÿ ThÃ nh phá»‘ Há»“ ChÃ­ Minh

Title: Xpath.Co
Description: I could not be happier with the tour given by An! She was punctual, well organised and knowledgeable of the local area. The tour she gave felt personalised and struck the perfect balance between including important historical and cultural sights from Vietnamese history, as well as providing a contemporary perspective of Saigonese life. It was made all the better for her having a great sense of humour and being genuinely interested in an authentic cultural exchange. If the other guides from the team are anything like An then you are sure to have a lot of fun and I could not recommend the experience highly enough!

Title: Mr Trung's Traditional Village Tours
Description:
Approached by Trung at a bar in the night market, he showed us books worth of great reviews (turns out he makes you write one at the end of the tour). He picked us up from our hostel but we had to provide our own transport, he doesn't use a car, just his own motorbike. Luckily we had free bicycles with our homestay.
First off was the fishmarket, there was no fish as he starts the tour after they are all sold for the morning (which he neglected to mention when we signed up).
Got to go out in a little fishing boat and use a net to catch fish, great experience, but Trung just sent us out with someone else that he'd paid. Probably worth doing this as a solo activity.
Pottery was next, he managed to talk for so long and still give so little information. The pottery 'class' that he advertises is actually just letting you touch some clay for like 20 seconds (we kept getting shoved off for doing it wrong, but they didn't tell us what we were meant to be making).
Then off to Trungs house, the cooking class was only spring rolls, and he let us cut some beans and carrots for a stir fry. Not very educational about Vietnamese cuisine. Other reviews mention his son running the class, perhaps our experience was very different because Trung himself ran the class. His family also ate separately to us, which was exceptionally awkward, especially as at the end he insisted we pose with his wife and daughter for a photo on his phone (no doubt to advertise the happy tourists to his next victims at the pub).

He seems to drag things out, talks slow, repeats himself a heap, and also drives very slow, presumably to use up time in the 5 hours we paid for.

All in all, perhaps a good experience for a group of tourists looking for a slower day, but with not much actually done or learned, and with no opportunity to explore his 'village,' it was a waste of half a day for a young couple looking for an educational tour.

Side note: he has 2 kittens and a dog called Fat, absolute highlight of the tour (almost worth the 475,000 dong each).

Title: Serene Garden Cafe - Cooking Class
Description: Een oase van rust in het immens toeristische stadje. Je loopt er zo voorbij maar het is de moeite waard om het kleine gangetje in te lopen. De aangename tuin en vriendelijke bediening maakten dat we vol verlangen uitkeken naar ons eten. We bestelden mango-papaya salade, garnalen in tamarind sauce en gevulde inktvis. De drankjes waren lekker koel. Het smaakte overheerlijk. En het was er leuk vertoeven. Nu de versleten lampionnen nog een keer vervangen en dan is het zicht ook helemaal in de sfeer van Hoi An. Een aanrader!

Title: Asia Essence Tours
Description:
I've never been so excited to get home and write a review. Absolutely without a doubt THE BEST tour ever. We travelled from Hanoi, to Danang, to Hoi An, the Phan Thiet, HCMC and the the Mekong Delta with my husband and 7 & 9 year old daughters.
We trawled the internet for weeks to find a great local Vietnamese company for our family adventure holiday and hit the jackpot with Kate and Asia Essence Tours. As soon as I started making enquires Kate responded straight away. I was specific and knew what we wanted: Family Friendly, Private tours & transport, Adventure, Culture, Art, History, Travel, Farms, Poolside, 4-5star and Relaxation in two weeks. I gave Kate my budget (ex international airfares) and she sure delivered beyond our expectations!! She greeted us in person on the first day, gave us a SIM card and almost daily she checked in with us with meticulous details and made sure everything was running smoothly for us. We felt so supported and looked after by Kate and nothing was ever an issue. And her genuine kindness and concern was so comforting when traveling with kids somewhere totally new.
We did our own thing within our itinerary some days but as a family when there was a tour planned by Kate we had a motto 'if Kate planned it, it was going to be great" and it was every time. I think we may have even saved up to 30% on the prices of hotels and tours by booking with Kate also.
No one got sick, at no time did any booking not happen and Kate was always there to see us through.
I have done loads of traveling in my lifetime and this tour company without a doubt is the BEST I have ever felt with.
Look no further Kate at Asia Essence Tours gets 10 out of 10 from us and without a doubt we will be back to Vietnam!

We hiked 2 days with Su, his knowledge and enthusiasm meant we had amazing fun going through bamboo forests and rice fields.

At night we had dinner with Lala, Su & their family which was tasty and insightful. We also had happy water and played games.

I would recommend Lala's tour to anyone!

Title: Da Nang Tours

In the next few days, we will also visit the city of HuE under the leadership of Mr. Pouch. We visited the Forbidden City and walked along the Perfume River. We visited Marble Mountain and the shrine of "My Son" sanctuary. We received a lot of interesting and important information.
If you come to Da Nang, don't miss these programs.

Title: Color Vietnam Travel
Description: The whole experience in itself was the highlight. The tour guide was well educated and kind, she was very thoughtful and always checked in on us. She spoke perfect English also and was full of exciting and insightful information. I stayed at the valley view homestay and I arrived in the morning, the house manager organized our tour within moments. Hung is incredible and helpful and the tour itself was impressive. I had a cultural experience and I left feeling humbled and happy. I would recommend staying here and organzing any tours through Hung. This is a small family business that are welcoming and kind. A huge highlight was the food we had the restaurant we were overwhelmed with a great feast. Everything tasted lovely. 10/10 coming back to the homestay was an absolute blessing. The views are priceless and special. Again I recommend this tour and homestay.

Title: I Love Asia Tour
Description: We (family of 4 -- kids are 18 and 21) did the motorbike tour in Hue. We had a fantastic time. The guides we the best part -- friendly, knowledgeable and most importantly good drivers. They really went the extra mile to make sure that we enjoyed the tour. Our kids, especially, really connected with them. The 4 guides had different personalities and levels or competence with English. Since we were a group of 4 (and joined for part of the tour by a young couple from Poland), the diversity of the guides worked out well. If you are a smaller group and don't have as "chatty" of a guide, you could be disappointed. Based on the other reviews I've seen, I don't think this is an issue.

Title: Golden Vietnam Travel
Description:
This was a last minute addition to our existing itinerary , and we couldn't thank enough for being sane to make this decision.
We discussed, we contemplated we had our options in terms whether it has to be SAPA, Ninh Binh or travel further South of Vietnam,
but goodness gracious Thanks to our travel buddy cum assistant more of a Friend I would say, who gave us a very valid reason why it should be NINH BINH.
Even though it was a 1 night stay, we had quite a lot planned in terms of vist and activity. After a 2 hours driver from Old Quarters, we reached Ninh Binh,
hotel room checked and it was just has much what was required comfortable and welcoming.
We left our Hotel with our Guide Tina, who was too excited to show us around share all the possible information of various location that we visited, having
her around acted as a charm and we also did get invited by her for some traditional Vietnamese food at her home stay. Food was delicious, got some home prepared
rice wine to taste and overall a mixed group of people from various part of the world.
cáº£m Æ¡n báº¡n Vietnam for beautiful memories...

Title: Phu Quoc Street Food Tour - Eat with Locals, Drink with Locals
Description: We booked the tour in a very last minutes, but they was confirmed quickly & very detailed information for where we gonna meet, what to prepare. Our guide Katie was fantastic, she is so sweet & prepared everything for us carefully. We walked by the night market, she explained everything extremely well, we loved the coconut icecream & the pork skewers that are exactly how locals enjoy their food. The seafood hotpot is really good as well, really fresh & we could order something extra for our own choices as well. Their is no pushing at all which is really great. Title: Hanoi Goody Tours
Description:
When arriving in Vietnam we feared the local food a bit and wouldn't bring ourselves into trying it. We booked Huan so we can get iver this fear and it has been the smartest choice we made!
Huan took us to fantastic and tasty Vietnamese restaurants, for food, coffee and deserts. Not only that the food was amazing, Huan made sure to provide important and interesting information regarding the history of Hanoi, Vietnam and the food, which has been both inspiring and interesting, and helped us know the city and the country better.
Thank you Huan for a lovely 4 hours tour that passed by so quickly

Title: HoiAnbyYou
Description:
We were searching for something to eat and quite accidentelly arrived at Lucky's restaurant where he and his family welcomed us very friendly and warmly. He told us that he also offers tours and we booked a very spontaneous trip to a lantern workshop.
The next morning he and his friends picked us up at the homestay and took us first to a silkscreen fabric and then to a small lantern fabric where we also had the opportunity to do some on our own.
The whole tour was very interesting and Lucky and his friends took really good care of us (with fruits and water, yummy)
Some days later he organized a driver to get from Hoi An to My Son. It was a precious experience and we were really happy to get to know him. Nice, friendly and very helpful guy. Thank you so much. ( Also for the honey moon snack :) )

Title: New Eyes Travel
Description:
If you are looking for quality and authenticity this tour is for you ! We were in a small group (only one other couple) and we had two guides : Trinh and Moon, who speak a perfect English. They took us through Hoi An countryside, in small villages, far away from all the tourist attractions and we were the only tourists in the area (the villagers even seemed surprise to see us). We visited 3 local families who showed us their handicrafts (I won't spoil you but two of them were about food and it was an interesting and yummy experience !). The two guides actually know these families, it's not a show for tourists : they really share something with us and we got to talk about Vietnamese weddings, ancestors worship, and so many other things !

We highly recommend this bicycle tour if you want to :
- Discover Hoi An off the beaten tracks
- Take your time and talk with local guides about Vietnamese culture
- Eat good things (the lunch was very good too !)
- Meet local villagers
- Experiment traditional handicrafts with smiling people eager to let you try.

Cam on for this amazing day !

Title: Hoa Tuc Cooking Class
Description:
i think the cooking class is a bit overrated.

my friend and I chose the package with the market tour. the tour is very short, like 30 mins, without an immersive experience, just the chef pointing here and there and telling us what the ingredients are, but most of them are unrelated to what we are cooking.

if you cook occasionally, do not expect to get too much out of the class. the tasks in the class are super simple, like piling off the skin of carrots, and chopping things. most of the ingredients were pre-prepared by the team (seasoning like garlic is all cut for us, chicken is pre-cut, etc.), so we did not need to do much. The chef also showed us how to check if the chicken was cooked (if you cook, it is something you know). and the chef was gone in between the preparation/cooking of each dish.

they have morning and afternoon classes, i feel like it's more like a formulated business that they run every day over again.

Although it was nice learning to make Vietnamese food, do not expect too much.

In questo Hotel non hanno il minimo senso dell'ospitalitÃ , i proprietari si ritengono superiori ai loro clienti al punto di definirli degli sprovveduti che non conoscono neanche le norme elementari nella gestione della cucina. Uso e abuso di prodotti surgelati e di scarsa qualitÃ . Ogni volta che io e/o altri clienti abbiamo evidenziato la scarsa qualitÃ  del cibo ci Ã¨ stato sempre risposto che noi non avevamo esperienza nel settore. Faccio presente che personalmente sono circa dieci anni che trascorro un periodo di vacanze a Riccione mentre altri componenti la comitiva vi si recano da venti anni e oltre; forse c'Ã¨ qualcosa che non va in questo Hotel.
Il giorno del nostro arrivo, a me ed a mia moglie Ã¨ stata assegnata una "suite"( tale Ã¨ stata definita dal proprietario) che in un armadio a muro situato a capo del letto fungeva da deposito di materiale dell'Hotel e lo spazio per muoversi era estremamente ridotto. Il giorno seguente, a seguito delle nostre rimostranze, ci hanno trasferito in una stanza piÃ¹ grande. Abbiamo soggiornato tredici notti, le lenzuola sono state sostituite il giorno precedente alla nostra partenza, la stessa cosa Ã¨ avvenuta per molti dei componenti della comitiva (circa quaranta persone). Esperienza assolutamente da non ripetere per quanto ci concerne!

Title: Hue Local Tour
Description:
We usually do not review tours, but this time we had to. We had such an amazing evening with Ngoc. She introduced us with so much passion to Vietnamese food, culture and history. We had a lot of delicious dishes, which all were explained by Ngoc. She told us a lot of details of the meals, explained us the ingredients and how to eat the meals.
Ngoc took care of us, if we were friends since long time ago. Her passion for the tour, the Vietnamese cuisine and the country were present all the time.

Thank you so much for this incredible evening!

Title: Smart Asia Travel
Description:
My small group of five had a great experience with Smart Asia Travel on a customized tour of Vietnam and Cambodia. Duong handled the booking with detail and care and Tu, Huyá»n and Chhiev guided with knowledge, care and enthusiasm. In Vietnam, we explored historic Hanoi, experienced the breathtaking sites of Halong bay including kayaking and cave hiking, immersed ourselves into New Years in Ho Chi Minh City and took in the Mekong Delta by water, on foot and by tuk tuk. And in Cambodia we explored Siem Reap, especially Angkor Wat and Angkor Thom and explored the floating fishing village on Tonle Sap Lake.
All the plans were made by Smart Asia Travel including flights, transfers, hotels and guided excursions.
Smart Asia Travel is first-class and delivered exactly what we requested and more.
Girl Travel Tours highly recommend this local agency and plan to send more groups their way.

Title: Há»™i An Cooking Class
Description:
Wonderful experience. We chose this class because of the menu. We were 8 at the class, they picked us up from our hotels with a bus. First stop was the food market, where the chef made all the purchases for the day and explained some things, without us being involved as much as we wanted.
A small ride with a boat across the river and then directly to the cooking farm. Everybody had his own space and ingredients to cook. She gives explanations and demonstrates and then you cook the dish on your own. Everything was tasty! At the end you get the recipes and a small gift! Then follows a ten minutes ride through the water coconut fields, nothing special. At the end a ride home with the bus. Our chef Tin Tin was polite, helpful and professional helping us all the way but we missed some communication skills, smiling is always a good start! I would recommend it because of the menu and the professionality!

I took this private cooking class because I have some food allergic.

Teacher Justin had a lot knowledge and very kindness for my problem.
He is very Professional and friendly person.
He use only safe and clean ingredients for cooking class.
I think this is very important thing.

I heard that some other cooking class is just watching for teacher's works.
But we can cook all recipe in this class.
We cooked 3 kinds menu. Everything was easy and delicious.

Teacher Justin had unique experience. He worked on cooking TV shows staff. One of special guest was Anthony Bourdain.
I like Anthony's TV show and we talked a lot about food and culture.
This moment was not just Cooking class. It was very special experience for me.

I highly recommend This class.
If you wants special experience for cooking class.

Thank you Justin. You are Great teacher!!

Title: Magical Mystery Tour Nha Trang - Viet Garden Cooking
Address: 3/35 Tráº§n Quang Kháº£i, Nha Trang 650000 Viá»‡t Nam
Description:
Today we enjoyed a fabulous day with Dat of the Viet Garden Cooking Class. It truly was a real â€œfield to forkâ€ experience.
We visited the herb and vegetable growers, watched the coconut milk being extracted from coconuts, shredded the rice noodles; then went o the local market to buy the rest of the ingredients.
At the cooking school, the facilities are clean and very welcoming, and being outdoors, there is a nice natural breeze and ceiling fans to keep you cool.
We got to prepare the ingredients, cook the food (and of course eat it!) : pork & prawn spring rolls with chilli dipping sauce, marinaded fish in lemongrass, shallots & fish sauce, coconut chicken curry with rice and noodles.
We really loved that we got to see the origin of every aspect of the ingredients we were using.
Highly recommended - Dat is such a warm and welcoming person, even my husband who normally does not cook absolutely loved the whole experience

Title: VietMate
Description:
We arrived in Vietnam, (Ho Chi Minh) for our 3 week trip with a loose plan of travelling to Hanoi then working our way back to Ho Chi Minh, We had booked the first two nights accommodation, Internal flights and a Halong Bay Cruise. With nothing else booked we contacted Minh and asked if he could organise tours (Meekong Delta, Chu Chi Tunnels, Ninh Binh, Phong Nha Cave, waterfalls, Ba Na Hills, the Marble Mountain and Hoi an). Minh arranged all accommodation, travel, guides, meals and activities to suit exactly what we wanted to get out of the trip. The highlights of this trip where definitely all the great places we visited and the icing on the cake was the Cyclo ride around Hue with Minh and dinner at Banana Mango. The conclusion of our Vietnam visit was made complete by enjoying lunch with Minh in Danang before flying to Ho Chi Minh to get our flight back home.
Huge thanks to Minh, his family and his team for making our trip Awesome.

Title: VIETCAM HOLIDAYS
Description: Don met us when we arrived in Chau Duc off our fast ferry service from Phnom Penh. Very affable and easy to get on with from the start. Description:
First you are greeted by Charlie the chef with a cup of artichoke tea beside a gorgeous view of the lake. You are then taken to the local market to get the ingredients, Charlie was very informative and knowledgeable on the local produce and was happy to answer all of my questions. You are then taken for a refreshing drink of sugar Kane juice and then back to the kitchen to get cooking! Charlie is a great chef and an even better teacher! He was very patient while I failed at deep frying spring rolls with chopsticks! You then get to eat the delicious food you have cooked, Charlie presented it to me on a big platter while saying the happy birthday tune hahaha! Thank you Charlie and everyone else for an unforgettable authentic Vietnamese cooking experience :)

Anna

Title: Kin Trekking Tours Sapa
Description:
We had the best time trekking for two days in Sapa. Kin has arranged everything for us, transport from Hanoi to Sapa, homestay, tickets for the cable car and areas which we visited, water, breakfasts, lunches, everything.
I have contacted Kin on Facebook, and he responded very fast and answered all of my numerous questions. He wanted to create a plan which suited us the best.
We arrived at Sapa at 4 am and Kin got to the station to pick us up, we went to the homestay where we could shower, sleep and eat breakfast.
On the first day, we hiked to Cat Cat Village, had lunch in Sapa town and after lunch went to Fansipan by cable car.
On the second day, we walked through rice terraces, Y Linh Ho village where we also had lunch. After lunch, we continued our walk to Lao Chai and Ta Van villages.
During the day Kin asked us multiple times which route suits us better - if we want the route which goes up and down or the one where you walk on the road.
The price was fair. The food was great. The homestay - GreenHouse Sapa is also really nice. The night bus from Hanoi to Sapa was also much more comfortable than we expected.

I can not imagine a better tour guide, we have experienced Sapa, learned a lot about their culture and seen beautiful nature. If we haven't booked a tour guide, we wouldn't be able to see so much and hike on such interesting routes.

Thank you Kin, and I would recommend him to everybody!
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 4 trÃªn 11 Äá»“ Äƒn & Äá»“ uá»‘ng á»Ÿ Sapa

Title: Private Dinner with Local Family in Dong Hoi
Description:
After an amazing (but exhausting) 2 days trek to, in, around and back from Hang En cave, we decided to spend a few days in Dong Hoi.

Our bike tour - led by Thai - was 100% the highlight of our time in the city. Thai is charming, knowledgeable, fun and has an excellent grasp in English.

He steered us well clear of tourist traps, leading us to local haunts, fish markets and Bijou coffee bars.

We ate and drank extremely well for a very small amount of money. The tour also ran over 4 hours long, and Thai would've gone on longer if we hadn't had to leave.

We highly recommend this tour to anyone planning to spend a few days in Dong Hoi. You won't regret it.

Title: See You In Viet Nam
Description:
It was an amazing experience. We got to know Hoi An from the perspective of a person living here. We got to experience a vegan community we would have never found on our own and saw parts of the town hidden to the normal tourist.

The food stops were unbelievably delicious and the story's provided with them made you feel connected to the people and to the food they are offering.

The guide was very helpful before and after the tour and provided us with tips for running and shopping in town that were great.

We also had stops in between were we learned about the history and development of Hoi An.

We got to talk a lot and learned many things about living and life in Vietnam.

We highly recommend booking this tour, doesn't matter if vegan or not. An amazing experience that we will remember.

Title: Vietnam Food Safari
Description:
Pedr collected me from my Hotel in the afternoon. I was his sole passenger that day.
Very nice guy and good company. Genuine ex-US Army 1963 Jeep was great fun!
Unfortunately, I had developed a slightly delicate stomach during the day but he was very helpful.
First stop was a local drinks stall where he got me an interesting lime juice drink. it was great for settling my stomach. The market was fascinating. Even though I live in Hong Kong and am used to Wet markets, this was more reminiscent of Asia 30 years ago!
With live frogs, eels, great looking fresh fish.
Lots of different meats. Great looking Pork Belly, Pigs ears, every part. All legal!
We had a delicious Viet 'pancake' on the traditional little red stools. No idea what was in it, but very good. Then a more traditional deep fried Banana pancake, which was also helpful in calming my inside.
I did not want to risk too much, so I declined his offer a fish restaurant.
Instead, he took me on a trip in the jeep to the lady Buddha, which was great in the Jeep.
On the way back, we stopped at a local Pub for a Beer and some 'drinking' snacks.
Then off to the Night market. This was more touristic, less of a local Market, but located next to a fabulous Buddhist Temple in full Prayer mode.
So many food stalls here of every description. Even 2 Australian guys making Pizza!
We tried a very delicious Viet dessert. Like poached Quail eggs in individual deep fried corn baskets. Very nice indeed. And lots of good conversation about his home, Freemantle.
My only regret is not feeling well enough to fully try all the different dishes he showed me, but he did his best. Entirely my own fault.
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 25 trÃªn 98 Äá»“ Äƒn & Äá»“ uá»‘ng á»Ÿ ÄaÌ€ NÄƒÌƒng

Description:
Fantastic tour. Yen greeted me in HCMC, from where we made our way to the Mekong Delta by minivan with bicycles in the back. Over the next three days, Yen took me on some amazing bike rides through areas that were so interesting and diverse. We took ferries on several occasions and jumped back in the van once or twice. The tour covered area around Vinh Long, Can Tho and Cai Be.
We stopped at several places of interest over the three days, took in a great boat trip and the floating market near Can Tho. Yen organised a wonderful trip for me. Included breakfasts and lunches were wonderful and the accommodation each night was of very high quality.
Yen was fantastic. Her knowledge of the area was first class and she had everything so well organised .. from accommodation to the boat that met us in the middle of nowhere to take us on a great trip down the river to where we could continue cycling from ... Thank you Yen, for a very memorable tour. I highly recommend her, fantastic guide (I would have got totally lost trying to do this on my own!) along with being very friendly and personable. Thank You.

Title: Dark Cave Phong Nha Tours
Description: A friend and I came to the cave and spent a hilarious couple of hours getting involved in the sporty and active adventure within the cave. We missed the safety video which in hindsight would have been helpful as we did not know how to successfully stop ourselves as the bottom of the zipline (we both graciously crashed into the mat). We had a lot of fun with our tour guide who helped us get equipped with helmets and torches before we acclimatised to the cold water, swam 10-40m to the cave entrance and hiked in through a muddy pathway. The guide called out when we needed to slow down to get safely through the tunnel. We arrived at a mud bath which was very slippery but the whole group loved getting fully involved in the mud and we had a great laugh all together. If you do not want to get muddy, this trip is NOT for you. Then we went back out for a cold dip and to remove the mud from our bodies and clothing, before kayaking (which was a lot of effort after we had laughed so much) back to the adventure course. This part is optional but we stayed and did a mini zip line, a big dive into the water and a small assault course over the water. A very fun afternoon and well worth the price if you are with a good group of adventurous people!

Title: TeaTour Travel
Description:
It was such a splendid tea tour and precious experience for me and my friend. Our gorgeous tour guide Angel and the red lotus tour agency arranged a perfect itinerary for us during our 2-day tour.
They took us to La Bang commune the first day where we enjoyed picking tea leaves with the warmhearted local people and had a look at their household tea workshop. It was excited for us to take part in the tea making process. Then we had a delicious lunch in local household. They served us with a kind of expensive fish which looks like a shark. It tasted quite different from the normal fish. I felt like it's more chewy. Our tour guide Angel is very informative with tea knowledge and I got a lot of useful information about tea planting, tea processing and tea drinking from her.
On the early morning of the second day, we went to the tea market of the La Bang Commune in which we bumped into the woman who hosted us to her tea making household workshop yesterday. She also came to sell her tea. The tea market was filled with local tea makers and tea wholesalers from different places in Vietnam. They were all busy with judging the tea quality and bargaining the tea price. So we didn't stay long there and then we headed to Tan Cuong Commune which is also famous for tea plantation and the Nui Coc lake. The view of lake and boat ride were all nice, but the most impressive experience for us was that we visited a local tea processing leader's house. Over there we saw the ancient tea trees. some of them are even taller than 2 meters. The host also taught us another traditional way to fry the tea leaves. It was very interesting that we could have the firsthand experience. Most importantly, the host's wife is an excellent cook because she cooked some dishes with tea leaves which were creative and fresh. For us, we prefer to the fried matcha toufu and steamed fish filled with fresh tea leaves.
The tea cultural space is also a destination you should not miss because you can learn some history of planting and processing tea in Thai Nguyen and also appreciate the delicate ancient tea wares.
In short, I truly would like to recommend this tea tour for you if you are tea lovers or you are interested in tea and tea culture. The tea culture tour is a combination of sightseeing, knowledge learning and food tasting. The tea tour guides are all very funny, friendly and patient. If you take part in this tour, you will not be disappointed.

Title: Villa Hue Cooking Class
Address: 2 Vo Thi sau st, HuÃªÌ 5300 Viá»‡t Nam
Description:
During our stays at the hotel we took a cooking class which was conducted in the hotel restaurant kitchen. The class covered 3 traditional Hue dishes in about 2.5 hrs with plenty of hands-on. While each standard classes offered 3 pre-determined dishes we discussed with the restaurant manager to mix and match the dishes that we were keen to learn.

The Chef/instructor was very professional and happy to demonstrate and share her culinary skills, though she speaks only Vietnamese but it was never a problem with one other staff acting as interpreter for us. There were just 2 of us as a couple in the class so we received full attention and free to ask questions and practice throughout the session. We thoroughly enjoyed the cooking class and the food that we helped cooking during the class.

Though the recipe was emailed to us at the end of the course it was quite brief. hence it is highly recommended that particpants take note of the steps if you want to replicate the dishes, which we did when we return home!

Title: Aodaigo - Day Tours
Description:
My family and I went on a tour with the ladies into the surrounding countryside where we visited a lagoon, went to a home in the mangroves where a couple had resided for over 30 years, a boat ride through the lagoon and then lunch at a local Vietnamese house.

The ladies were all really lovely and spoke perfect English. Having never been on a scooter I was a bit nervous however the ladies all drove really safely and I felt completely confident in them.

The boat ride was so much fun and a really nice added bonus.

The food we had for lunch is some of the best we have had in Vietnam so far and we had a wide range of dishes including prawns in passion fruit sauce, beef skewers, banana flower and duck salad and lots more.

Everyone in my family said this was their favourite activity in Vietnam so far! I wish I could do it again!

Description: Recommended by a friend who lives in Nha Trang and we're so glad he did. The bar is built around a traditional Vietnamese distillery where Kilo makes his own Rum from molasses and Brandy from fermented fruit. I can highly recommend all of them but beware. It's strong stuff. Musicians seem to be particularly welcome but if you just want to sit and enjoy the music you'll be just as welcome too. The pizza's were epic. The atmosphere is lovely. Make the effort to go here. You'll be as glad we were if you do!

Title: Thanh Dong Cooking Class
Description:
We visited this as part of a bike tour around the shrimp farms and rice fields, a trip around the local market and finally a quick go down the river in a baker boat. This was all super informative and fascinating as well as very picturesque and relaxing.

We then went on to the eco farm which is one of the first in the area to avoid any form of chemicals or pesticides in their very beautiful organic farm. We were shown around by Hamy who was translating for one of the farmers, both lovely people. The farm is a lovely experience where we also picked a few of our ingredients for the cooking class.

The cooking class was led by the wife of the farmer and her son, they were brilliant at explaining the ingredients and as it was only a small group (which they aim to maintain) it was very personal and unrushed. We prepared, marinated and cooked several dishes and then went to eat in a lovely setting between the farm allotments where we enjoyed the food we had prepared and the conversation with the locals and our other tour guests.

Such a fabulous and memorable place and I highly recommend visiting.
Rank_of_province: Sá»‘ 95 trÃªn 167 Lá»›p há»c & há»™i tháº£o á»Ÿ Há»™i An

Title: Vietnam Retro Tour
Description:
Our guides were Eric and Henry. They were very attentive, courteous, knowledgable and good fun. They take you round to all the sites in Hanoi, some less well known ones amongst them. We also visited a cafe to have an "egg coffee" this apparently is something they developed due to a shortage of milk in the Vietnam war. It tastes surprisingly very nice.
We were a bit apprehensive when we booked it due to the traffic in Hanoi and us only having a motorbike and sidecar to protect us. But we felt safe the whole time. Its an exhillerating way to see the sites either riding pillion or in the sidecar.
The whole way round Eric was taking photos which he later sends to you on Whatsapp.
So we thoroughly recommend this trip. If you only do one site seeing trip in Hanoi you wont go wrong with this one.
